name: 2 - Soil Management Plan - Construction and regular Updates submitted to the Administrator for approval
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Written Acceptance
6 - Material transported from a Red Imported Fire Ant Zone has complied with all relevant laws and regulations
7 - Materials are stored to ensure no deterioration or contamination occurs

8 - Materials; including pesticides, soil amelioration agents, soil, seeding, turf, mulch, matting, plants water, plant bed edging and irrigation systems, comply with requirements and specifications set out in MRTS16 Clause 7 where applicable

9 - Containerised plants and ex-ground stock inspections conducted with Administrator, with 5 days notice, prior to delivery, within two months of acceptance of Plant Supply Proposal and every two months thereafter (where growing period is greater than 2 months)
10 - The extent and types of vegetation treatments are installed as specified in the contract and/or shown on the drawings
Ground preparation works carried out within the drip line of retained vegetation, 300mm of paths, kerbs, road furniture or structures and in accordance with TMR Standard Drawings 1644 and 1646
Reference - MRTS16 Cl 8.1 TMR SD 1644, TMR SD 1646
12 - Site is weed free prior to ground preparation operations
13 - Administrator notified at least 3 days before each of the following:
○ Application and incorporation of amelioration agents
14 - Stockpiled topsoil is in accordance to Form D - Manufactured Site Topsoil Compliance Testing prior to being used
15 - Topsoil installed evenly over the surface, within 5 days of subsoil preparation and at the required minimum depth
19 - Fertilisers are broadcast evenly over topsoil in accordance to manufacturer's recommendation and the prepared surface has had a water and a wetting agent applied
20 - Turf installed within 2 days of topsoil, within 24 hours of delivery and in accordance to Table 8.2.2 with initial watering on the day of installation and at least 10L/m2
31 - Certificate of commencement of landscape and revegetation works establishment period issued and is a minimum of 90 days

32 - All Establishment operations; including, watering, fertilising, weed, pest and disease control, mowing, slashing and brush cutting, pruning, and repair and reinstallation of failed plants, comply with Clause 9.1.1
33 - If a plant failure is determine to relate to the species, a substitute species has been proposed and submitted to the administrator for suitability
34 - Certificate of commencement of landscape and revegetation works monitoring period issued and is a minimum of 90 days unless otherwise specified

35 - All Monitoring operations; including, watering, fertilising, weed, pest and disease control, mowing, slashing and brush cutting, pruning, and repair and reinstallation of failed plants, comply with Clause 9.2.1
36 - Certificate of finalisation of landscape and revegetation works monitoring period issued
Supervisor/QA Verify that the Above has been Constructed according to Specification
Project Manager Verify that the Above has been Constructed according to Specification
